intro: Clematis alpina subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the Western alpine clematis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a deciduous vine characterized by its slender stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
